comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Full caption: 6713 P.Z. - Roma. Tempietto di Bacco in Villa Borghese. Bacco is the Italian version of Bacchus (or Dionysus). Bosco is something different entirely... From 1896.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The original caption on the photochrom print "Tempietto di Bacco" is wrong. This building is named Tempietto (or Tempio) di Diana (see u.o. www.tripadvisor.com/LocationPhotoDirectLink-g187791-d1901...). The inscription on the temple is "noctilucae silvarum potenti" (To the mighty nocturnal light of the forests). See www.flickr.com/photos/maurocaoduro/3384094525/ Forest is "bosco" in Italian.
